title: To the Lighthouse - would like "to see him gowned"

content.prompt: The passage suggests that Charles Tansley would like Mrs. Ramsay “to see him, gowned and hooded, walking in a procession” (seventh sentence) because

choices.label: he would like her to understand the conflict within him
only when so dressed could he reveal his true feelings to her
he believes she would be favorably impressed with his status
he fears that the clothes he is wearing betray his humble origins

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Describe how textual details reveal nuances and complexities in characters' relationships with one another.
